definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: The amount of time you spend alone has little to do with being lonely.
sentences.chinese: 你大部分独自一人的时间想必和寂寞扯不上什么关系。

sentences.english: Guess you can justify anything with words.
sentences.chinese: 想必适当措辞可以使一切正当化。

sentences.english: My readers know what I’m getting at.
sentences.chinese: 读者诸君想必知道我用意所在。

sentences.english: No doubt the younger sister of the one who had come to his room.
sentences.chinese: 这想必是刚才来他屋里那个姑娘的妹子。

sentences.english: I think this is what the Treasury Department says, that they are kinda busy with other things until then.
sentences.chinese: 想必财政部会托词说，他们到那时才有时间。

sentences.english: A: I think you know already that I want to discuss the representa- tion for your alarm clocks.
sentences.chinese: 想必你已知道，我想和你商谈你方闹钟的代理问题。

sentences.english: And your roommate would be very pleased.
sentences.chinese: 想必你的室友会很开心。

sentences.english: It ought to be ready now.
They'll probably soon forget about Borders as well.
sentences.chinese: 想必他们也会很快忘了鲍德斯。

sentences.english: Cuddly looks when I must have slept Hin also seen.
sentences.chinese: 睡时我的憨态想必轩也看见。

sentences.english: Having heard the battle drums and horns, it is certain that our troops have started their attack.
sentences.chinese: 耳听得鼓角齐名，想必我们的军队已经开始进攻了。

sentences.english: You look worn out. You must have been working all day.
sentences.chinese: 你看来很疲乏，想必你是干了一整天的活了。

sentences.english: The man with the green umbrella will be our new president .
sentences.chinese: 拿着绿伞的那个人想必是我们的新任董事长。

sentences.english: In that it will make people have a in another family's feeling of taoyuan.
sentences.chinese: 住在那想必会让人有一种身处另一个桃园家境的感觉。

sentences.english: The examiner must have been pleased with my performance.
sentences.chinese: 主考人对我的驾驶想必是满意的。

sentences.english: She must be nervous,she fusses about all the time.
sentences.chinese: 她想必很紧张，她一直忙碌得团团转。

definition: to be convinced (that sth is true)/to believe/to accept sth as true
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to be certain/to be positive/assuredly/definitely/to give recognition/to affirm/affirmative (answer)
to talk about/to mention/(preposition) as for
needless to say/it goes without saying
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
to mention/to bring up (a subject)/with regard to/as for
to be bound to/to be sure to
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
